text: Hélène Sofie Edlund (20 October 1858 30 June 1941) was a Swedish photographer.Acta Societatis Skytteanae, In the 1890s Edlund collaborated with Artur Hazelius documenting the buildings and nature of Skansen. Her nineteenth century photographs of folk costume are used to decorate locker doors in the Nordic Museum. ==See also== * ==References== ==External links== * Category:1858 births Category:1941 deaths Category:Swedish women photographers
title: Hélène Edlund
